values:
just so i don't forget, because i really liked it.

The bad and the evil according to Magdalena:

Look here Elias, you can probably understand me because being an Indian, you know what it feels like to deal with discrimination and racism. I don't know, it's like there's a hatred for anything that's different. And that hatred doesn't just stop with looking at you askance, making fun of you, joking about you, or humiliating and insulting you. No! That hatred goes as far as murder. Some of us guys, or rather girls, have been killed. Sometimes you hear about it and sometimes you don't. And I'm not talking about being murdered in the course of a kidnapping or robbery. No! They murder us for no other reason than hating that we're different. And when something bad does happen, the first thing they thing is that it was one of us, because they believe that our difference is not anything natural, that it's some kind of perversion, some kind of evil. As if our sexual preference is the result of a criminal mind, a personality trait of delinquents... or of animals- one bishop said we were like roaches. It's no wonder that whenever anything bad happens it's always one of us, someone who is gay, lesbian, or a tranny, or a sex worker- one of us is always first suspect, the first one accused of anything bad. So then, one has to hide his or her difference or bury it in some dark street. And why should we hide what we are? Don't we work like anyone else? Don't we love and hate like anyone else? Don't we dream like anyone else? Don't we have defects and virtues like everyone? We're the same but different. But no, to them we're just animals, horrible degenerate creatures that have to be exterminated. And don't ask me who I mean when I say "they", because I don't know what to say. It's just they, them, all of them, even the ones who call themselves progressive, democratic, leftist. You see what they said about Digna Ochoa and Pavel Gonzalez? The authorities said she was a lesbian and he was a homosexual, as if that were reason to preclude justice. And since they were that way they were depressed, and the best thing they could do was commit suicide. It's disgusting! Screw the city of hope! Yes! Because if anything happens to one of us male, female or otherwise, the best they can come up with is "he/she had it coming"... They say we're aggressive. true! But that's the only way we can defend ourselves. If someone is always trying to screw you, it's only logical that you should feel that people are trying to screw you. And I wish I were talking about sex- no, I'm saying that they're trying to fuck you over. So we use the same rejection we suffer to defend ourselves. 

- the uncomfortable death.
apparently i like taking pictures of feet.

unfortunately my camera died in paris so i couldnt take pictures of alot of good things. but if guru gives me her pictures... you'll see pictures of the eiffel tower as a disco ball. my feet are disgusting and camille is adorable: nappy cat at the pharmacie: this dog loves life: camille and cerise's brutal five flights of steps:

x loves dogs: darin points to his nipple: dirty asssss feet: nathan is... really weird. sketch river! wine and pina colada at sketch river becky is definitely sketched out by sketch river i'm definitely drunk at sketch river i definitely peed on this shoe
petanque! marseille hates dogs: the "beach": lunch:

gothenburg hates ice cream: for joaquin, cj, zach, and tyrone: breakfast, lunch, and dinner: hostel on vegagatan. please note: ikea furniture. fresh ass produce: cake collective shows support for fallen punk houses worldwide (wah wah wah): karius! stina and malin's legs! i forgot your name! stuffed with stripey pink ice cream: they call these "murder slugs": swedish femme zine: abygatan 13 aka the molndal collective aka the cake collective: hick ass: the collectives crazy ass back yard:
hella naked babes: pleasant oslo graffiti: oslo fjord: hi we're tourists we got lost in the oslo countryside:

becky guru amrit montana and anastasia's curly head montana hailey jolie a pig in a farm inside the city montana and natasha at the farm a lamb at the farm the east end with anastasia kill kill kill turtle soup sketchy alley london graffiti

we spent a few days in marseille with nathan and darib and spent a day on the jagged rock beach of the mediterranean. we all have a few cuts on our feet to show for it. i did not bring a bathing suit which was stupid so i swam around in a dress which seemed to amuse some of the locals who, the majority of were topless.

then the five of us spent two unexpected nighs in aix en provence which is only a fourty five minute bus ride from marseille. aix was really awesome at night but during the day it was full of rich tourists. we got drunk down by the river.... which was sketchy. the river. not us.

this morning we narrowly missed our train for paris. we got to paris and it is raiinnnningggg. camille, our host, took us on a little walk around montmartre which is the incedibl touristy part of the city. i think it used to be ho,e to alot of intellectual arty fartsy types in the 60`s. sartre and de beauvoir lived on the street in the 30`s - 70`s

we all started our periods today... so we are all a little grumpy and ready for some relaxation.

marseille is sketchy and dirty. i think we might leave today or tomorrow to go to paris or somewhere.

yesterday we swam in the mediterranean sea. marseille has horribly, jagged, rocky beaches.

today was a great day. we woke up really late, around 130, and decided to make the girls dinner since they made us traditional swedish dinners last night.


we made them beans, rice, and guacamole. weve only been here a few days but it feels like we have been here for weeks. its a very good thing. we love it here. tomorrow is our last full day and weve decided to ride bikes around the city and go to some second hand shops and to the falafel square, where we can get some good falafels to eat.

we are ttrying to convince some of the girls to come to new mexico but it is not as easy as it was to convince jolie, natasha, and hailey (montanas flatmates).

on wednesday we leave for marseille and leave the cake collective!! everyone here is amazing. i wish i could bring them all home with me.

and greg, you would love the cake ladies. they are adorable and sweet. such such such such adorable punk girls.

today was norways independance day. everyone was dressed up in little traditional outfits and drinking all over the streets.

we went to vigeland park where there are giant statues of naked people. we walked around all day and saw alot of beautiful houses and parks.

guruamrits friends parents live on a little island just off the way from the the city. its really beautiful. today we got lost trying to find our way back to the house.


we are still deciding some final stuff about how long we want to be in gothenburg for. but this far oslo has been alot more amazing than i remember.

we are in  norway now!

london was crazy!! montana and his flatmates and his friends were absolutely incredible! last night we went to a pub where they had 2 yequila shots for 2 pounds and we actually drank all of the pubs tequila. they had to take down the sign. we got crazy. but montana will be home when we get there and his friends are coming in august!

we were supposed to meet jonathon and melissa today but we woke up too late!! i didnt have any way to get a hold of them so i feel really bad that we didnt show!

tomorrow is norways independance day so there will be alot of parades and festivities going on. it sounds like it will be alot of fun.

we are staying at guru amrits friends house and it is on this little island on a giant hill. its dark so i cant see anything but i bet its beautiful.

we leave for gothenburg the day after tomorrow.... actually i forget when we leave norway.

but everything is going great and i am having alot of fun.....
i feel like a fifteen year old writing a diary entry. regardless hi.
